new(http_response)

[Source]

    # File lib/response.rb, line 19
19:     def initialize(http_response)
20:       #@http_response = http_response
21:       @xml = Document.new(http_response.body)
22:       code = XPath.first(@xml, "//code").text
23:       if code.to_i > 0
24:         msg = XPath.first(@xml, "//error/message").text
25:         Configuration.instance.logger.error "ERRORCODE: #{code.to_s} MESSAGE: #{msg}"
26:         raise StandardError.new(msg)
27:       end
28:       Configuration.instance.logger.debug @xml.to_s
29:       begin
30:         info_node = XPath.first(@xml, '//wc:info')
31:         response_namespace = info_node.attribute('xmlns:wc').to_s
32:         m = response_namespace.match(/urn\:com\.microsoft\.wc\.(.*)/)
33:       rescue => e
34:         Configuration.instance.logger.warn @xml
35:         Configuration.instance.logger.warn e
36:         m = nil
37:       end
38:       if m.nil?
39:         @info = nil
40:       else
41:         begin
42:           mod = (m[1].split('.').collect {|s| classify(s)}).join('::') + "::Info.new"
43:           # eval may as well be called evil
44:           nfo = eval mod
45:           @info = nfo
46:           @info.parse_element(info_node)
47:         rescue => e
48:           Configuration.instance.logger.error e
49:           @info = nil
50:         end
51:       end
52:     end

[Validate]
